Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to domestic abuse; inconsistencies in testimony regarding dates and events
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected refugee claim; judicial review dismissed
Grounds_for_Claim: Domestic abuse in country of origin
Assessment_Factor: Credibility assessment based on inconsistent testimony
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant not credible due to contradictions in testimony
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to domestic abuse
Evidence_Assessed: Contradictions in dates and events despite documentary evidence
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Board's negative credibility finding
Governing_Rule: Standard of review for credibility findings is reasonableness
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to domestic abuse alleged but not established due to credibility issues
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to domestic abuse but faced credibility issues during the Board's assessment
Evidence_Handling: Board reasonably addressed discrepancies; no requirement to explicitly address all contrary evidence
Evidence_Issues: Contradictions between oral testimony and documented events
Evidence_Assessment: Board assessed credibility based on internal inconsistencies
Decision_Rationale: Decision was justified, transparent, intelligible, and within range of acceptable outcomes
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to reconcile oral testimony with documentary evidence
